alert.note: Alert for City of Galax; Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 7:41AM EDT until June 20 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Carolina and southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in North Carolina, Alleghany NC, Surry and Wilkes. In southwest Virginia, Carroll, City of Galax and Grayson. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Camp Branch, Bull Run, Cane Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Bussels Creek, Chestnut Creek, Bee Tree Branch, Big Pine Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Beaver Creek, Basin Creek, Big Bugaboo Creek and Brush Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Galax... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Sparta... Independence... Fries... Ronda... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
